inn1.comm: on a length, middle and length, defended to mid-on
similar delivery, just short of a length, around middle and leg, Thirimanne closes the face, is beaten and hit on the pad
a length ball angled across him. Pitches off and goes with the angle. Thirimanne wafts at it, and is beaten

dropped him. A dream start ruined. Easy catch from Bijoy at first slip. He has another waft at a wide length ball, and this time gets the edge. Bijoy is wide at first slip, it has come straight down his lap, at a comfortable waist height. Just doesn't see it all the way in. Has three grabs at it, but grasses it
runs this off the outside half of the bat, gets a single to third man
short of a length, on the stumps, defended back to him
starts outside leg, holds its line, called a wide
swing for Rubel, but this starts middle and leg, and even though it has beaten the inside edge the ball is headed down leg
massive wide down the leg side, Mushfiq does well to collect it
on a length, shaping back in, defended to mid-on with a straight bat
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to mid-on
on a length, quite sharp at 139ks, defended off the back foot
wide length ball, drives through it with an open face. Beats point and cover. Lovely square drive. Rubs salt into that wound from the drop in the first over
short of a length, pitches middle and leg, angles outside off, hits the inside edge
length ball, on the pads, dropped into the leg side for one
short of a length, angling in, defended to midwicket
clipped away off the hip for a single
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, just outside off, angling away, left alone
Thirimanne continues to live dangerously. This is short of a length, outside off, and he chases it. Edges it just fine of that short gully
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man for one
Dilshan drives on the up, with an open face, past the diving man at point
bouncer, he ducks under it, Mushfiq has to leap in the air to just get a hand on it. Dilshan wants the bye, but Thirimanne is not alert
short of a length, on the pads, defended back to him
short of a length, gets it to rise towards the ribs, defended back to him
wide, big wide down the leg side
Thirmanne's charmed life continues. Flicks this in the air with a square leg in place, but gets it just wide of that man
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-off
short of a length again, from wide on the crease, pushed towards mid-on and steals a single
length ball around off, trying to sucker him into another drive, but this time Thirmanne lets it go
short of a length this time, he stays back and defends outside off
nice drive as he gets close to the line of this length ball, but can't beat mid-off
another sucker delivery outside off left alone by Thirimanne
short of a length, just outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
yet another wide down the leg side
on a length, angling in, defended in front of off
and yet another wide, angling well down the leg side
angling too far into the pads, and has been picked away for an easy couple straight of fine leg
accurate now, on a length, angling in towards off, defended from the crease
short of a length, looks to go hard into the off side, mistimes it
half-volley this time, just outside off, driven with an open face, past the diving man at cover
on a length, middle and leg, bunted towards mid-on. Thiri wants a single, but Dilshan sends him back
on a length, pitches off, angles away, left alone

moves around in the crease, first towards off, then backing away and stepping down. All of that amounts to nothing as he is beaten on the drive to a short-of-a-length delivery. Draws an optimistic appeal from Mushfiq
rare leg-side half-volley, and Thirimanne clips it off the toes, past midwicket
short of a length, angling in from wide on the crease, punched to midwicket
stays short of a length again, defended to mid-on
starts outside leg, tucked away for an easy single
wide length ball, Dilshan goes after it, is beaten, but this is called a wide. Not possible to reach balls this wide
wide half-volley, Dilshan plants his front foot down, and crashes this wide of mid-off for four
looks to drive at another half-volley, but the bat face closes a little and ends up hitting this back to the bowler. Think this one doesn't quite come on to the bat
tries the bouncer, gets it shoulder high, and Dilshan gets stuck into it, pulling it over square leg
short and wide, and Taskin is lucky Dilshan has found cover-point with the cut shot
on a length, pushed towards mid-off, he sets off for a quick single, and gets an overthrow from the ricochet off the stumps at the non-striker's end
short of a length, on the pads, defended to leg
full, on off, slight shape away, runs off the outside half of the bat to cover
on a length, on off, no room, defended watchfully
mid-off is wide, which is why he has thrown his arms at a full ball and hit it through mid-off in the air. Gets a couple. Soumya Sarkar has given it a quick chase, and restricted them to two

Thirimanne is a cat today. Has a life after life. Might end up with nine. He edges Mashrafe outside off again, playing a nothing drive to a length ball. The first slip is wide, this is flying wide of the keeper, Mushfiqur wants to go for it and bails out at the last moment. Aww. Mushfiq should have gone for it. The slip is wide. Thirimanne gets four for it
short of a length, outside off, left alone
down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the ball, plays it back to Shakib
driven down to long-off for one
Oh Thirimanne. He should walk out of the ground, and walk along the Yarra and walk right into the Crown Casino. Another edge as he pushes at one outside off, but this too flies wide of slip
tossed up, middle and leg, defended
presses forward before going back to punch this down the ground. Short straight cover puts a dive in, but can't save the single
stays back to punch this to short straight midwicket
full and wide, driven wide of mid-off, but Thirimanne is ball-watching on what should be an easy single. Dilshan makes it back in time
looks to play this slightly short delivery square on the wicket, and is beaten. Not short enough. An optimistic half shout for an edge, but there isn't any
drives this with an open face, wide of deep cover, comes back for a second
another powerful drive but straight to mid-off
full, just outside off, driven again, but straight to mid-off. Again the bat face closes a touch
that's a half-tracker. Gentle long hop. Dilshan gets stuck into it again, and pulls it through midwicket for four
tossed up outside off, pushed to mid-on
stays back to defend a length ball with an open face
short of a length, punched back to the bowler
half-volley driven to long-on for one. They have taken the single although it has gone off Dilshan's pad at non-striker's end
down the wicket to pad this away
short of a length, defended to cover
half-volley, driven to deep cover for one
flighted outside off, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, worked into the leg side for one
flighted on off, pushed to cover off the front foot
fuller and flat, pushed with an open face
flatter, Thirimanne stays back to defend
pitched up on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
down the track but too close to the ball, defends it back to him
flatter, stays back although the ball is full, and punches it to deep cover for two
down the wicket, not close to the pitch of the ball and pads this away
down the wicket, again not to the pitch of the ball, and defends this towards mid-on
nearly yorks him with a full flat one. Dilshan keeps it out
flighted, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one
flighted into the pads again, and driven to long-on again
lovely shot. Down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, makes a little bit of room to make some room, and drives him between mid-off and cover. All along the ground
flatter, into the pads, worked to leg for one
slower through the air, Thirimanne drops it towards cover and sneaks in a quick single
flat delivery, he stays back and punches this to deep point for one
tangled into the pads, swept away fine but can't beat short fine leg
slower through the air, dropping in on a length on off, defended with an open face
flatter and quicker, punched to deep cover for one
down the wicket to chip this over cover for two
flat, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
on length outside off angling across, driven late behind square on off for one
touch back of length towards middle and leg, tucked to deep midwicket for two
good length ball this time towards off, he wants to steer it to leg but gets an inside edge on the pads
full on off, driven firmly down the ground to mid off
good length on off, pushed a bit wide of cover point for one
just back of length on off and angling across, pushed into the covers. Tidy over from Taskin
bit of flight just outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
charges down and muscles a drive straight to mid off
turning in from off and middle, helped to the leg side easily for one
flat and short just outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
flat on the leg side now, pulled late to deep backward square for one
full on the pads, tucked late but straight to short fine leg. Just three from the over
quick, back of length delivery outside off, Dilshan chases but it seams away to beat him
length delivery angled towards the pads now, driven down to mid on
full on the stumps, driven back firmly and Taskin stops it
just back of length outside off with some room, Dilshan cuts it late to backward point
on length outside off, pushed towards point and Dilshan is sent back for the single
fullish outside off, Dilshan drives and gets a thickish edge to the leg side. That's a maiden
slow, length delivery outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
this one was flatter, Dilshan takes out his reverse sweeps and it goes under his bat down leg. Premeditated shot that one
on length on middle, makes room and pushes to midwicket
makes a bit of room again and cuts the ball on the off stump to short third man
pushes this one down to long on off the back foot for one
shorter and flat towards off and Dilshan rocks back to swat-pull it between long on and deep midwicket, finds the gap for four
angles across the length delivery outside off, driven late to point
closer to the off stump, Thirimanne slices it to third man for one
bit too full on the stumps and Dilshan crunches it straight down the ground for another four! Full face of the bat, sweet timing, nobody could chase that
pitches this one shorter outside off and Dilshan cuts it straight to point
full again, this time outside off and Dilshan drives it nicely through the covers this time, four more!
he's taking them on, four more for his fifty! He expected the short ball, stayed back and pulled it over midwicket
turning in from middle, pushed to midwicket
full on leg, driven down by making some room to long on
goes on the back foot and punches to cover
touch back of length on middle and leg, pushed down to long on
misses a stumping! This one went past Thirimanne as he came down the track, was beaten outside off and Mushfiqur spills the ball
replies by hitting it over the bowler. Got a full delivery and smashed it straight down the ground in the air to beat long on and long off
full outside off, driven through the covers wide of sweeper cover. Dilshan wants two and a widish throw makes sure he's safe
too full again, on off, Dilshan powers a drive back and Rubel stops it with his right foot. Looks like he has hurt himself
back of length outside off, he pulls it over midwicket for one. No time for the second
room on offer well outside off, it was shortish too, Thirimanne slashes and misses
good ball - yorker on the leg stump, Thirimanne digs it out on off for one
outside off now, guides it to third man for one
touch short around off, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket for one
on leg stump, he goes back and pushes it down to long on for one for his fifty
flatter and fuller well outside off, chops it to deep point for two quick runs
flighted full toss on off, flicked to the leg side for one
flat on middle, makes room and cuts it to cover point
fullish on middle and leg, tucked on the leg side off the pads for one
room outside off, cuts guides it easily to third man for one
angled in, pulled with the angle to deep backward square for one

straight to third man, the stand is broken! Rubel banged in a short ball just outside off, Thirimanne didn't move much and only ramped it with the face of the bat to third man. Taskin should have come forward a little bit but completed a low catch successfully in the end
length delivery around off stump, pushed into the covers
touch back of length on off, Sanga defends on the leg side
bangs in the bouncer, Sanga ducks and it's not a wide
short of length outside the off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
offcutter from outside off, Dilshan slices it late wide of third man for two
short ball towards the batsman, tucked to the cover region for one
length delivery outside off, pushes wide of point with soft hands to get off the mark
angled in towards the batsman from back of length, can't clear midwicket
full on the pads now, driven wide of midwicket for one now
length delivery angled in, steered to deep midwicket for one
doesn't offer any room - right on off stump on length, Sanga defends it back
Sanga does a Thirimanne but plays it fine for four. Got a short ball from Rubel, he stayed back and ramped it fine over the slips for four
just outside off, pushed with soft hands into the covers for a quick single
muscles the widish delivery to point, Sanga comes nearly halfway down the pitch and goes back just in time
on length on the stumps, he defends it back
length delivery on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
touch shorter towards the off stump, Sanga defends it back
outside the leg stump now, glanced down the leg side easily and they come back for two
still on the leg stump, steered to deep backward square for one more
back of length on the off stumps, defends solidly into the covers
full and outside off, slices it late to third man for one
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler. Rubel jumps and stops with both hands, gets a big cheer from the crowd
huge cheer this time as Bijoy dives to his right to stop the powerful cover drive
slower offcutter outside off, cut off the back foot towards point
tucks the ball from off and middle towards midwicket, they set off for the quick one, good early call. There's an overthrow but no time to come back for the second
back of length on leg stump, tucked off the hips to the leg side for one
short of length ball angling in, pulled with the angle to deep fine leg
turning in from just outside off, helped to the leg side for one
outside off with a bit of turn, turned to long on off the back foot for one
well outside off and Dilshan turns it to long on too, one more
bit of room outside off, Sanga cuts it late but can't clear point
slower and well outside off, oh that's sloppy fielding! Sanga punched it off the back foot straight to cover and that went through Anamul
fuller outside off and steered to point now
back of length well outside off, Dilshan sees the room and taps it late in the air, fine enough to clear third man for four. Clever shot
fullish on off, driven down to long on for one
on length on middle and leg, steered off the back foot to deep midwicket
bangs in a bouncer and it goes through to the keeper
back of length outside off, cuts it late off the bottom edge to third man
bouncer just around leg stump, Sanga ducks under it
fullish outside off, driven to point off the back foot
shorter outside off, Dilshan gets time and punches it off the back foot to clear cover point now, and gets four
slower through the air, flight and turn, Dilshan helps it down to long on
length delivery on middle, pushed down to long and gives the strike back to Dilshan
flighted but around leg now, steered to deep backward square for one
comes down the track and tucks the ball to deep midwicket for one
on a length, on off, pushed to cover
stays back to punch this length ball square, but can't beat point
fuller, pushed towards mid-off with soft hands, calls Dilshan through for a quick single
short, wide, cut away to deep cover
full, on off, Sanga has driven it wide of mid-off. All along the ground. He has threaded the gap
dropped. Solid attempt in the follow-through but he has failed to hold on. This has stopped on Sanga, and has lobbed in front of Taskin. He stops in the follow-through and then lunges forward
full, middle and leg, driven to long-off
flat and quick, defended off the back foot
driven down the ground for one
moves in the line, dabs this fine but can't beat short fine leg
full and wide, he moves across, covers the line and drives it between mid-off and cover
short of a length, outside off, cut straight to point
again short of a length, and again punched straight to point
full, middle and off, drilled to short midwicket. Sanga wants a single, Dilshan doesn't. Words exchanged
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a couple into the leg side
into the pads again, gets inside the line and works this to fine of fine leg for a couple
short of a length, outside off, and Dilshan finds point for the third time in this over
moves across to a length ball outside off, gets a leading edge towards cover
moves inside the line again, tries to sweep, but misses. Lucky his leg stump is standing
short of a length, punched down the ground for one
down the wicket and slogs this over midwicket for four
swept away, but gets just the one this time
length ball outside off, driven on the up, straight to extra cover, though
clears his front leg and slogs at a length ball, gets a couple wide of deep midwicket
slower short ball, half-pulled to midwicket for one
short of a length, angling in, Dilshan is beaten by one that skids through
full and wide, pushed wide of mid-off for one
wide length ball, Sanga clears the front leg and smashes this straight down the ground for a four back over the bowler's head
nicely played. Short of a length, on off, he opens the face, but is denied a boundary by the diving short third man
punched off the back foot, gets a single to extra cover
half-volley outside off, and even though Sanga is opening up his front leg to every delivery he has managed to drive this through the covers for four
stays back to a shortish ball and pulls it to deep square for one
pitched up on off, doesn't let it turn and drives it to long-off for one
superb delivery. Flipper or a toppie. Pitches within the stumps, skids through and hits him right in front. Sanga has got a bottom edge to save himself here
looks to pull a shortish delivery and is beaten
full toss outside leg, he paddles it, finds short fine, sets off for a run that doesn't exist. Sent back but makes it in time
makes room to drive this to long-on for one
flat delivery, into the pads, worked away for a single to square leg
down the wicket, not to the pitch of it, pushes this to midwicket
gets inside the line of a flat delivery to sweep it square for a four to bring up a fifty in 400th ODI
makes room, Shakib slows it down, and Sanga is beaten
legbreak flighted on middle and leg, hit back to the bowler
flatter, quicker, punched away square, misfielded at cover-point
driven down the ground to long-off for one
wide, big wide down the leg side, Mushfiq too fails to collect it
short, makes room to pull it wide of long-on for a couple
flighted outside leg, swept straight to short fine. He has missed out again
comes down the ground to take this on the full and drive it to long-on
plays the reverse. Takes this from outside what would have been leg and lofts it over point for three
full and slow, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, he rocks back to punch it to deep cover and reach 99
makes room to drive this low fullie down to long-on

the hundred is up through an inside edge. He jumps outside the crease, is beaten in the flight, but gets an inside edge fine of short fine leg. Century No. 21. Looks up at the skies in gratitude. Valuable player
looks to reverse over point but is beaten

another drop. Bangladesh have been fielding poorly. the whole system has broken down. Cut straight to Mominul at point, who has dropped a sitter by international standards. Then he throws at the bowler's end in frustration. The bowler doesn't know a throw is coming, and the long-on has turned his back ton the game. Almost four overthrows a couple of yards to the right of a fielder. Poor stuff
and now that he has reached the hundred, Dilshan becomes more adventurous. Ramps this full ball over short fine leg's head
shapes up for the ramp again, realises the length is not quite right, and he sweeps it square
straight six. At any ground it is a joy, but at MCG there is something extra to it. Makes room to get under a full ball, and sends it sailing back over the bowler's head
this time he opens the face and gets a single
charges at him to try to slash him over cover, but is beaten by a slower ball
starts with a low full toss, drilled down to long-on for one

another low full toss, hit straight to extra cover, Dilshan is halfway down the wicket, but Mushfiqur has not taken one step towards the stumps. This is poor keeping. And the fielder misses with the direct hit. Really pedestrian from Bangladesh
dug out for a single
low full toss, driven down the ground, but can't beat mid-off
full, just outside off, driven straight to extra cover
which is why Sanga tries to move inside the line and ramp this, but the ball is a touch too wide, and he gets just a couple wide of short fine leg
looks to reverse-hit this one, and is beaten what would have been outside leg
Dilshan tries another reverse hit, and Mahmudullah slows it down this time to beat him outside off. Gets a leg-bye
short, pulled away between long-on and deep midwicket. He has the field back on the leg side, but can't afford to drop it 11 yards down the wicket
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
driven down to long-on for one
Sanga is on fire here. He gets outside off, in line with an offbreak, and then sweeps this over square leg for four more
Dilshan gets the length ball he has been looking for and clears cover with ease. Poor delivery with the field on the off side up in the circle. A length ball outside off
slightly short of a length, still an ordinary delivery, but Dilshan is beaten by the pace this time
slower ball, Dilshan doesn't read it, and he cramps him up with the middle-and-leg line. Gets a dot out of this

this time Dilshan makes room and drills this full ball between the bowler and mid-off. Decent delivery. Full to cramp him up with a strong leg-side field. Dilshan plays it well by making room and timing it superbly
another slower ball, this time Dilshan has picked it, and he swings it square of deep square leg for four more

misses the yorker. This is a low full toss. The idea is right, the execution isn't. He has swung hard at it, and has cleared midwicket with it. Deep square leg can't get around in time. Four fours in the over
slower through the air, slightly short of driving length, beats the bottom edge as Sanga looks to go square on the off side
that's a Sanga special. This is full and wide, flat too, and he plays the trademark extra-cover drive, going inside-out over cover
slower through the air, driven square of deep midwicket for two
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
looks for the reverse again, and is beaten by a long distance. Bangladesh are asking for an lbw, but Aleem Dar has called byes. And rightly so
looks to sweep this from wide outside off, hit on the pad as he is early into the shot
he starts short and wide with third man and point inside the circle. Ordinary. Cut away for an easy four
full and wide with the off-side field up in the circle. Just don't get this thinking. Drilled past extra cover for four more
slower yorker, Dilshan is early into an attempted sweep. Gets an inside edge onto the pad
lovely shot. Can't do much against such batting. He makes room, gets under a length ball and chips him over cover. Superb timing too
driven into the off side again, but this time they have placed a deep cover
again on a length and outside off with the off-side field up. Lucky that Dilshan has found extra cover with this shot
down the wicket to work this into the leg side for a single
full and flat, Dilshan sweeps, gets a thick inside edge past short fine leg. That brings up the 300
full and wide, well bowled. Beats the outside edge. Just inside the tram lines
tries the full and wide ball again, but Dilshan this time reverses his stance and sends it between point and short third man for four. This is a switch hit
tries another reverse shot, but he has slowed it down and beaten Dilshan outside off
and a slugged boundary to end the over. This is a length ball, and he has hoicked it past square leg for four more
low full toss, Sanga gets a single to long-off
nice yorker, swinging in. Dilshan digs it out for a single
Rubel stays full and straight, he is driven but along the ground and just for a single to deep cover
misses the yorker by inches. Dilshan goes deep into the crease and lofts him over midwicket for four. His third 150 in ODIs
wide yorker, he has squeezed it out between point and short third man, and they come back for the third too
Rubel stays full and straight to Sanga, who digs it out for a single to mid-off. He is 99 and has the strike
there it is. Sanga's fastest hundred. In his 400th ODI. Driven hard down to long-off for the single. 35,000 at MCG are on their feet. Sanga is congratulated by Dilshan, and they go back to business
low full toss into the pads, and he has placed it between fine leg and deep square leg for another four
short, too short, that's a big bouncer. Too high
short, pulled away to square leg for a single. That's Dilshan's highest score in ODIs
looks to move inside the line to ramp this length ball over fine leg, and is beaten clean by a full ball outside off
full, on the pads, he stays deep in the crease to get under it, and he has picked the gap between long-on and deep midwicket for four more
low full toss, driven to deep cover for one to end the innings

inn2.comm: starts with a widish delivery outside off, Tamim lets it go

bowled him, that went right through him! What a delivery from the man! It pitched around length outside off, it had swing, it drew Tamim forward and it found the gap between bat and pad to know the off stump over. Tamim looks back at his stumps in disbelief, gone for a duck
inswinger again, gets a thick inside edge off the bat as Soumya drives on the leg side
Malinga's on fire! Swinging yorker this time, right on the front foot with Sarkar trying to get bat on it, and it's going down leg
attempted yorker is a full toss and it's driven down the ground sweetly for a four, to beat a widish mid on
loud lbw appeal, given not out, SL don't take a review. It was anther yorker with swing, Soumya couldn't get bat on it but it was probably going down leg
full outswinger, defended in front of off
another outswinger, squares Bijoy up, defended from the crease

whose catch is it anyway? It is such an easy catch that they have dropped it. Bijoy just dances down and throws his bat at it, and the top edge flies between mid-off and cover. Nobody seems to have called for it, and in the end Dilshan drops it. You could have had a snack and then come back and caught this
width here and Sarkar drives it on up through point for four
more swing, Sarkar opens the face on it to get a single to third man
short of a length, into the pads, they get two leg-byes
full and straight, defended to mid-on
on a length, swinging away, defended with an open face
slower full ball, defended to leg
bouncer, he goes deep into the crease, and pulls this over square leg for four
short of a length, on off, hits the bat hard and high
short of a length, outside off, soft half-pull into the leg side
lovely drive. Wide length ball, he presses forward and crunches this between cover and cover-point
short of a length, wide, beats the cut, but is wided
uppish drive outside off, but the sliced shot has enough on it to clear mid-off
lovely drive again. This is full angling in, but still wide enough to allow him room for the drive. He beats the short cover and also extra cover
short of a length, outside off, steered down to third man for one
outswinger, around off, squared up again. Lakmal has been bowling superbly to the right-hand batsman
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
length ball, angling in, defended from the crease
full, nearly a yorker, quick, pushed to mid-on
slightly off-pace low full toss. Actually it is a slower ball. At 121. Goes uppishly towards short midwicket, but clears the leaping Thirimanne there
short of a length, on off, beats his closed face and hits him on the forearm
short of a length, hits him on the thigh pad
full, middle and leg, played wide of mid-on, but they decide against the single after both have come halfway down the wicket. They make it back in time, though
nice outswing outside off, bit too full and it's pushed to cover
bit too short and Anamul rocks on the back foot to muscle that with a pull over the backward square leg boundary for six
short of length on the stumps, tucked to short fine leg
shuffles across a bit and steers the ball with soft hands to the leg side for one
he also strikes in his first over! This delivery was angled across the batsman well outside off, Soumya chased without any footwork and edged it for the keeper
angled across again off length, taps it to third man for one

beaten outside off! This one was quick outside off, Mominul slashed and missed it. Oh, hang on, SL are asking for a review! Nobody appealed straightaway, Sanga took the ball and passed it on to one of the fielders but one of the fielders heard something. Looks like there's nothing on the bat, given not out. Snicko is not available for this review and Jayawardene is livid about it. The SL players are crowding around the umpire
he goes this time, caught at slip! Outside the off stump, Mominul chases to get a thick outside edge to first slip where Jayawardene, standing slightly straight, takes a low catch near his knees
length delivery swinging away from outside off, left alone
towards the leg stump now, deflected off the pads down to fine leg for one
on length on the off stump now, keeps a touch low and he defends it back
swinging in towards middle and leg, glances it late to fine leg for one
full on the pads, tucked away off the legs for two
on length outside off, he reaches out and pushes it back
straighter one on the off stump, defends it back to the bowler
on length outside off and swinging in, left alone
just outside off on length, doesn't move his feet much and defends on the leg side
angled in from short of length towards the batsman, he takes it near the hips while trying to put it away on the leg side
this one is going away from the batsman outside off, he chases and misses
just over point! Anamul pushed tentatively at this one outside off, didn't swing his bat completely and it just cleared Dilshan at point
beats him with pace again - angled it in towards the pads and hit the one on the front
swinging away from outside off, leans forward a bit and blocks

that was a superb attempt from Mathews, but couldn't hold on to it! Anamul charged down to clear mid off, got some bat and the ball was going over Mathews who ran back, jumped at the right time to get both hands to it, but it popped out
angled in towards the batsman, tucked to the leg side by closing the face of the bat
slightly full around off, pushed down to mid on
full on middle and he flicks it nicely off the pads wide of the square leg fielder to find the gap between him and fine leg
presses forward and blocks the length ball to short cover
fullish and going towards leg, Mahmudullah deflects it off his pad very fine down the leg side for four leg byes
well outside off now, punched between point and cover point off the back foot for two
falls well short of fine leg. Anamul pulled the short ball from middle stump, got a top edge and it fell well before Herath who was running in
length delivery on the off stump, pushed down to mid on
back of length towards leg stump, steered to fine leg for one
on length around off stump, turned to deep midwicket for one
well outside off now, he taps it late to third man for one
much closer to off stump on length, blocked back to the bowler
starts with a leg-stump line, tucked to backward square
length delivery just outside off now, pushed to cover
on leg stump again, deflects it fine towards short fine leg for one
and one more down leg, this one goes off the pad just past Sanga for leg byes
sightly slower on middle and leg, steered to backward square leg for one
middle-leg line on length, helped to backward square but can't clear him
length delivery outside off, pushed into the covers for one
on middle and leg now, turns it with the wrists wide of fine leg and they come back for two
shuffles across a bit to push the ball from outside off towards midwicket for one
just outside off, flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot for one
swinging in this time towards the pads, steered to the leg side for one more
outside off now and swinging in, he leans forward and blocks
pretty full well outside off, Anamul drives and misses
length delivery outside off, pushed to cover
straight and full on off, pushed back to the bowler
touch quicker on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
flighted on the middle stump, drives it late to point
flighted on the pads now, steered easily to deep backward square leg for one
back of length outside off, Anamul chips it in the air, but safely, towards midwicket

run out chance missed, that was a horrible mix up! Mahmudullah pushed the ball into the covers and went for the run, Chandimal stopped which made the batsman go back and Anamul also started running towards the batsman's end, direct hit missed and there's nobody backing up
he charges and slogs, doesn't middle it but gets enough to collect four at the midwicket boundary
short ball just outside off, pulled with a top edge to deep midwicket
direct hit this time, but looks like he's safe. Anamul pushed the ball down to mid off, set off early for the single and even put in a dive to be in comfortably
back of length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover for one

SL have messed it up again, or have they? Easy run out chance as Mahmudullah tucked the ball to midwicket and Anamul wanted the single, running down the pitch even though his partner didn't move. Herath was ready to collect the throw behind the stumps, he doesn't collect but replays show it was a direct hit and Anamul is gone. It's time for drinks
full, on off, driven to cover
pushed into the pads this time, turned around the corner for a single
stays back to a length ball, plays with an open face to point
mid-off caught at its heels and they take a single
slower through the air, on a length, defended in front of off
short of a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, widish, dabbed away for a single
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, into the stumps, worked away for a single
runs this shortish delivery to third man for one
on a length, just outside off, stays back to defend
flighted around middle and off, no turn, defended off the leading edge
quicker, flatter delivery, stays back to defend
floats this through, slower through the air, beats Shakib's edge as he looks for the cut. No turn here
rocks back to cut this flat delivery for a single to deep cover-point
slower, much slower through the air, defended off the front foot
fuller, driven to left of Herath who has dived full length to save one run. Dilshan is so thrilled he is piggybacking Herath in congratulation
short of a length, on off, defended
looks to cut this shortish delivery, and is beaten by the low bounce
rides the bounce on this and runs it to third man for a single
half-pulled from just outside off, to short midwicket
fuller and straighter, clipped away off the toes
short of a length, no room, nearly chops this on as he looks to open the face for a single
sweeps softly from middle and leg, finds leg slip, but on the bounce
flighted, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
overpitched, pushed straight of mid-off, and Shakib is sent back
tossed up on middle and leg, drops it to leg for a single
full, on off, pushed back to him
slightly short, goes back and punches this to long-on
digs this one in short, but this is too short and slow, and he has pulled this over midwicket for four
shorter, higher, on leg, this time he stays inside the line. Would have been difficult to control this one
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, pushed with an open face to point

Herath is having a good day in the field. Mahumudllah goes. This is short of a length, Mahmudullah tries a swivel-pull, gets a top edge, which is massive and carries almost all the way to fine leg. Herath charges in, almost over-runs it and loses it in the lights, but recovers well to hold on to it
full, on off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
stays back to defend this length ball back to him
full, on the pads, clipped away for one
driven to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven to short cover
quicker, flatter, he has glanced this around the corner, but wide of the leg slip who thought it might be in business
nicely tossed up, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face to point
leading edge as he looks to turn this to leg, gets a single to third man
short of a length, wide, cut away for a couple to the right of deep cover-point
bouncer, but outside leg. Not called, though. Paul Reifell is the umpire
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
short ball, rib high, pulled away fine of fine leg for a couple
tossed up wide outside off, driven to deep cover for one
flighted around off, driven straight to short cover
lovely offbreak. Slower through the air, dips on him, creates distance between him and where the ball is pitched. Then gets the turn to take the edge but he doesn't have a slip
full, middle and leg, pushed to short straight midwicket
quicker one, Shakib is beaten as he looks to punch but this has somehow missed the leg stump
flighted, middle and leg, pushed to short straight cover
short of a length, outside off, moves a touch away. Mushfiq stays inside its line
lovely outswinger. On a length, just outside off, and then skids away. Beats the edge
short of a length, just outside off, runs this down to third man for a single
on a length outside off, pushed to cover
slingy delivery, skids through from a length just outside off. Beats his outside edge
fuller, driven to deep cover for a single
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
slower through the air, shortish, worked to short fine leg
short of a length, punched to deep cover for one
flighted on middle and off, defended back to him
flat delivery, angled in, cramps him up
makes room to drive this to cover-point
yorker, just outside off, dug out to point
bouncer, middle and leg, Shakib ducks under it
short of a length, just outside off, played with an open face to point
yorker, almost, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single to fine leg
full, into the pads, finds short fine leg
stays full, on off, defended to leg
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for a single
makes room to drive this but still hits it back to Dilshan
slower through the air, dips on him, turns slightly, defended with an open face
driven to deep cover-point this time for one
quick, fired into the pads, defended to leg
Shakib finally shows intent. Comes down the wicket, is not close to the pitch of the ball, but lofts down then ground, and manages to avoid the outstretched hands of the diving Chandimal at long-on
hit back to Herath
makes room to cut this straight of deep cover for a couple
down the wicket to drive this along the ground but straight of mid-off for four. A better shot than that six
another good shot. Makes room and crunches this shortish delivery through extra cover for four
wide down the leg side
some grip for Dilshan as Mushfiq looks to open the face to third man. Extra bounce too. Soft hands make sure it doesn't lob up
cut away for a single
backs away and smashes this back to Dilshan
down the wicket, gets too close to the ball, plays it back to Dilshan
punched down to long-off for one
tries a legbreak but it is a long hop that has been pulled away through midwicket for four
dances down first ball and gets a healthy edge to a short delivery for four through third man
lovely shot. This is short of a length, just outside off, there isn't much room, but he has managed some solid power behind this cut. Beats third man
short again, pulled away to the left of deep square leg for a couple
short of a length, on off, defended
on the pads, and worked away for an easy single
steers this shortish delivery to third man for one

beautiful shot, and dropped by Malinga at long-on. Mushfiq os down the wicket, not very close to the pitch of the ball, which is what allows him room to loft it back Dilshan's head. Malinga makes the ground from long-on, is quite close to the rope, which must be playing on his mind, and he drops it
cut away to deep point
driven to mid-on
rocks back to cut, can't beat point

Malinga gets another bite at the cherry, and it's the bigger wicket this time, that of Shakib. Bangladesh's best player charges down the wicket, the ball stops on him a touch, and he ends up playing a check drive, which settles in Malinga's lap at long-on
pushed past cover for one
full, on middle and leg, defended to square leg
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
similar flighted delivery, defended off the front foot again
drifting into the pads, glanced away, but not too wide of leg slip
short of a length, goes back to punch this back to Herath
too straight, swept away fine, between leg slip and short fine leg
full, on off, pushed back to him
driven to long-on for one
defended with an open face
goes back to a shoritsh delivery, worked to leg for one
fired down the leg side, called a wide
shimmies down the wicket to work this to leg for one
picked off the toe for a single
flat, just outside off, defended from the crease
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
slower in the air, defended in front of middle and leg
length ball, into the pads, worked to leg for one
on a length, turns a little, stops a little, defended to leg
down the wicket to drive this past extra cover. Lovely timing on it. He will get four for it
back of length towards the batsman, tucked to backward square leg
that went through him - slow yorker at 120kph, just outside off and Sabbir was beaten completely
fullish now outside the off stump, pushed wide of point for one
short of length again towards leg stump, helped towards fine leg for a quick single
bouncer this time, just escapes from being called a wide down leg. First for the over
slow and full well outside off, driven wide of extra cover for an easy single
starts off with a bouncer just outside off, Sabbir drops his hands and sways out of the line
back of length offcutter well outside off, he taps it late to third man for one
bang on middle stump, Mushfiqur defends it back
dances down to take the ball on the full and gets a thick inside edge to long on
short ball outside off, pulled in the air wide of midwicket for a single
bouncer again outside off, given a wide this time as it was left alone
full and well outside off, steered with a horizontal bat wide of third man in the gap
back of length just outside off, taps it late to third man for one
quicker and short of length again outside off, Sabbir blocks off the back foot
goes back in the crease to cover his stumps and defends the straight delivery solidly
short and outside off, he guides it by opening the face of the bat between point and third man and gets two
yorker on middle stump, digs it out to midwicket from the crease
slow full toss around the thighs, steered easily behind square on the leg side for one
outside the off stump on length, defends off the back foot to point
short of length outside the off stump, sliced to third man for one
fuller outside off now and he drives it down to mid off
outside off with not much room, punched off the back foot to point
slow bouncer outside off, at 127kph, Sabbir lets it go
hurries him up this time, 134kph, Sabbir fails to tuck it on the leg side and takes it on the body
quick and on back of length, he defends it late to point
tries a big heave on the leg side, doesn't get anywhere close to it outside off
towards middle and leg now, tucked off the back foot towards backward square for one
slightly slower outside off, guides it to point but can't sneak in a run
quicker one and shortish outside off, Sabbir opens the face of the bat late and guides it fine on the off side to beat third man for four. Very well placed
drives the fuller ball on middle and leg to midwicket
comes down the track, sees the full delivery and gets it fine on off with an edge while trying to slice it on the off side. Gets four
got 'im, bowled! Slower ball on middle and leg, Mushfiqur made room but didn't know Lakmal had run his fingers over this ball and was beaten by its pace after exposing his stumps
gets a yorker first ball and manages to tuck it to the leg side to open his account
short ball, he picks it up early and gets inside the line to middle it with a pull to the midwicket boundary for four
slow offcutter well outside off, he pokes his bat out to guide it fine and Herath tumbles after chasing it to keep it to two
full around off, pushed straight to cover
Mashrafe comes down and takes it on the full to turn it to leg for one
full on off, driven straight to cover
shorter and angling towards leg, helped to backward square
flighted outside off, he comes down and blocks it on the off side
flight outside off again, not much room and he cuts it to point
presses forward and blocks it on the front foot
loud appeal from the bowler as he traps the batsman in front of leg but it's going down leg
dances down and swats the short ball over mid on with a horizontal bat for four. Mid on in the circle hard to be cleared and was cleared easily
offcutter well outside off, guides it to third man for one
offcutter outside off, the batsman defends it back
short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
good short ball angling in, Mashrafe looks to ramp it on off but misses. It angled in too sharply for that
reverse sweep for the ball outside off, it goes to backward point and goes right through him for a four! Sloppy fielding
does the leg side now, Sabbir wants to help it to leg and steps out of his crease temporarily but gets back by the time Sanga takes the bails off. Third umpire says not out
turning in from outside off, defends it to the leg side
goes down on a knee to sweep the ball to short fine leg
that one was aimed towards forward short leg! It's so wide down leg, but Sanga manages to chase and stop it. Aleem Dar gives a fuuny glare to Dilshan while signalling wide
beats him and Sanga does the quick work to stump him! Mashrafe came down to slog, missed the ball completely because of the pace and Sanga collected to stump cleanly before Mashrafe could come back
leans forward and gets a thick edge to the leg side
length delivery outside off, taps it to point
covers his stumps this time and blocks it back
offcutter outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
back of length outside the off stump, guides it late to backward point
too full and wide and he crunches it through the covers with a powerful drive for four
slightly shorter outside off and he chops it to third man for one
flighted outside off, Sabbir tries the reverse sweep and it goes off his arm towards leg slip
short and flat, pulled off the middle of the bat to deep midwicket
on length and just outside off, pushed back to Dilshan
turning in from outside off, he goes back and defends
punches the ball after it turns in from outside off
that one spun the other way and Rubel punched it into the covers
back of length outside off, helps it to point
full on middle and leg and this one is flicked in the air nicely to deep midwicket for two
errs down the leg side and Sabbir helps it along the way fine down leg for four to bring up his fifty
bouncer now on the leg stump line, Sabbir ducks under it
bangs in the short ball, makes Sabbir uncomfortable who gets a glove to it while trying to cover his chin and Sanga runs to his right to complete a good, low catch. Malinga gets his second wicket

he's finished it off with a yorker on middle and gets him lbw! Oh hang on, Taskin asks for a review. Taskin, a left-hander, tried to tuck the ball to leg but got his bat nowhere close to the ball and was trapped low and right in front of middle stump. The decision stays
